Romney compares himself to Reagan on foreign policy

Mitt Romney said today that his conviction and problem-solving skills would make him a foreign policy president in the mold of Ronald Reagan. (Globe, 1:54 p.m.)

Kimberly Rhode becomes first American athlete to medal in five straight Olympics

The 33-year-old Rhode made history Sunday by winning a gold medal with a record-setting, nearly perfect performance in women's skeet shooting. (AP)
  • Lochte, Phelps upset by France in swimming relay

Images include today's beach volleyball competition as well as Team USA in action -- plus, Needham's Alexandra Raisman performed on the uneven bars.

Vollmer wins gold, sets world record in swimming

Dana Vollmer of the United States set a world record to win the 100-meter butterfly at the London Olympics on Sunday. (4 p.m.)

Boy shot allegedly by father, hospitalized

Owen Benway, 9, is in intensive care. He and his sister Abigail were shot allegedly by their father, who then killed himself. Abigail also died. (Globe, 2:26 p.m.)
